title: Fed’s Clarida Affirms Fed Plans to End Bond Purchases by Mid-2022
sub_head: Central bank’s No. 2 official said he expects recent ‘unwelcome surge’ in inflation to prove ‘largely transitory’
body:
A senior Federal Reserve official said that he expected elevated price pressures would eventually fade despite a stronger-than-anticipated interval of high inflation this year.
Fed Vice Chairman Richard Clarida also said the central bank was on track to begin reducing, or tapering, its asset-purchase program amid stronger-than-anticipated inflation and robust economic growth and hiring this year.
